intro: Endlicheria nilssonii, commonly known as the Nilsson's endlicheria, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains in South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool temperatures and well-drained soil. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
